name: Isla Holbox Tour Discovery
description: At the far north end of the Yucatan Peninsula of Mexico lies Isla Holbox, a sleepy, largely untouristed island paradise that is known primarily for its tours to see large concentrations of whale sharks.  Part of the Yum Balam Biosphere nature preserve, Isla Holbox is home to an amazing array of nature, including pelicans, manta rays and huge flocks of pink flamingos.
